Package academy.mindswap.player

Class Player

java.lang.Object
academy.mindswap.player.Player
public class Player extends Object
Class that connects to server, sends and receives messages from game/server, creates a new board and gives instructions to it.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main method of the class Player Creates a new player instance and call the startPlay method of the player

    • startPlay

      private void startPlay(String host, int port) throws IOException
      Starts the player in the specified port and host that are referenced in the EnvironmentVariables Class. Create a new thread to send the player moves to the game Initializes receiveGameMessage method that uses the main thread to keep listening the game/server information.
      Parameters:
      host - the string that represents the host of the server
      port - the integer that represents the port of the server
      Throws:
      IOException - to main, when it's not possible to connect with the server

    • receiveGameMessage

      private void receiveGameMessage() throws IOException
      Read the information from the game/server. Allows player to know how to interact with the game and board. Creates board. Updates the state of the game. Receive the instruction to be able to play and the end game result.
      Throws:
      IOException - if client socket closed

    • extractGameState

      private String[][] extractGameState(String gameMessage)
      Extract the game state information from the game class received string.
      Parameters:
      gameMessage - the game class received string.
      Returns:
      a two-dimensional array of strings.

    • updateGameState

      private void updateGameState(String[] gamePositions, String[][] gameState)
      Updates the game state through the game positions that comes from game.
      Parameters:
      gamePositions - String array of the game positions
      gameState - two-dimensional string array that will be updated.

    • closeSocket

      private void closeSocket()
      Closes the player socket and terminates the process.
